meanings.sent1: The avicular feathers of the bird were colorful and beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The avicular behavior of the robin indicated it was building a nest.
meanings.sent3: The avicular chirping of the sparrow made the garden feel alive.
meanings.sent4: Her avicular nature shone through when she cared for injured birds.
meanings.sent5: The avicular wings of the eagle soared majestically in the sky.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the mouth or beak
meanings.sent1: The avicular shape of the parrot's beak allowed it to crack nuts easily.
meanings.sent2: The avicular structure of the pelican's mouth helped it catch fish.
meanings.sent3: The avicular design of the toucan's beak was both practical and eye-catching.
meanings.sent4: Her avicular smile brightened up the room with its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The avicular curve of the hawk's beak was sharp and precise for hunting.

meanings.definition: Resembling a bird or bird-like in appearance
meanings.sent1: The avicular patterns on the dress reminded her of a bird's plumage.
meanings.sent2: The avicular mask at the masquerade ball had feathers and a beak-like shape.
meanings.sent3: The avicular hat she wore for Halloween made her look like a colorful bird.
meanings.sent4: His avicular costume for the play transformed him into a majestic bird.
meanings.sent5: The avicular decorations in the garden attracted various bird species.
